name: moreover

B2 (used to add information) also and more importantly: The whole report is badly written. Moreover, it's inaccurate. Synonyms
in addition (to)
furthermore formal
as well (as)
More examplesFewer examplesPolitically, moreover, he faces a split in his party.He enjoys selling and, moreover, is good at it.She alleged, moreover, that the two of them had met before.

(used to add information) also and more importantly: It was a good car and, moreover, the price was quite reasonable.
